error_description: Appender and log level are set on ROOT_LOGGER, affecting all components and modules globally
Sets the timezone globally for the entire JVM instead of only for the logger, potentially affecting other modules, libraries, and scheduling operations
The default log file name contains characters valid on Linux but invalid on Windows (e.g., application:errors.log). This prevents installation/running on Windows

Removing all validation in createSecretKey causes the entire Spring Boot application to fail to start (throwing an uncaught exception during context initialization) whenever jwt.secret is missing, empty, malformed, or too short
PasswordEncoder created per request rather than as a singleton
The create() endpoint does not validate the UserRequest DTO. Invalid input (e.g., missing required fields) can lead to a 500 Internal Server Error instead of a clear client-facing error
